Transcript:
Jeffrey: No, no, no. Finish the recovery on 
the laptop first, and then send it back to cedars as soon as possible.
Dinah: Okay...

Jeffrey: Not now. Okay, right. No, no, I want 
it all. I want the deleted files, I want unwanted emails, everything. I want to 
know everything about Sandy Foster since he got that computer you got it? All 
right, then get back to me. Thanks.

Dinah: You know copying files is a waste of 
my talent. I offered to be your PR agent, not your indentured slave.

Jeffrey: Well, sorry about that. Now, pick 
those up. Mrs. Winslow, hi.
Cassie: Hi.

Jeffrey: I've been trying to get a hold of 
you. How's Reva?

Cassie: They sent her home from the hospital. 
How's your new assistant working out?

Jeffrey: Oh, she's... She's just great. You 
know, she's cheerful, resourceful, takes orders well. She's just a slice of 
heaven.

Cassie: I owe you an apology. I was pretty 
upset when I found out that Dinah was going to be working for you, and now I 
know why you did it.

Jeffrey: Why? Because no one else would work 
for me?

Cassie: No. You did it for my kids. You did 
it to keep us safe. You did it to keep an eye on her, and you did it for me.

Blake: It's kind of hard to imagine that 
death is the end for a man like our father.
Michelle: I'm here. What's the big emergency?
Blake: Hi.

Sebastian: Michelle, thanks for coming. We 
are leaving tonight.
Michelle: Leaving?

Sebastian: To collect what my father left for 
us. I have chartered a plane to Miami, and from there we are going to board a 
private yacht.

Michelle: And where are we going? Oh, you're 
going to be mysterious about that, huh?

Sebastian: Well, you want to learn more about 
your mother, right? And you want to respect our father's last wishes, yes? So 
get packing. Everything's set.

Blake: Well, almost everything. We're missing 
my mother. She's not coming.

Holly: I should have gotten rid of this a 
long time ago--burned it, buried it. But I couldn't let go of it, just like I 
couldn't let go of you. Oh, Roger. I loved you, and I hated you, sometimes both 
at once. But this is the day... Today is the day I am letting go of this. I am 
putting you to rest forever. Good-bye.
Reva: Hi.

Ross: Hi. Well, it looks like somebody's 
going home.

Reva: Yeah. You know, it's so odd not to be 
worried about my backside hanging out.

Ross: Well, I'm glad you're feeling better 
because I've got some news.
Reva: About the accident?

Ross: Yeah, the police examined the tire 
skidmarks at the accident site, and they determined that the driver accelerated 
suddenly, as if he sped up on purpose once he saw Tammy.
Reva: So then you think it was deliberate?

Ross: That's now a distinct possibility. Do 
you know anybody who would want to hurt Tammy?

Reva: You know, what if it wasn't Tammy they 
were after? What if it was Sandy?
JB: Hey buddy, back from the dead?

Sebastian: Chrissy, didn't Holly get my 
message?

Blake: Yes, she did, Sebastian, but she's not 
coming because she doesn't trust you. Apparently she doesn't trust anybody that 
had anything to do with our father.

Sebastian: I understand. Look, I haven't been 
completely honest with any of you. I was intending to steal from you.

Michelle: Well, thanks for sharing. Well, 
this has something to do with those coins, right? That's why you're stalking me?

Sebastian: I wanted to collect father's 
fortune for myself, yes. But then I met you, and Chrissy and Holly, and I 
couldn't go through with it, because I saw why my father loved you so much. And 
suddenly I had something--something more, far more valuable than a fortune.
Michelle: So you only screw over strangers?

Sebastian: Something like that but not 
anymore. I'm a changed man. So are you coming?
Michelle: Why not? I'm up for an adventure.
Blake: Count me in.

Sebastian: Okay. So we're off together. 
Itinerary, I don't suppose you'll need to tell Danny.
Michelle: No, I told you. That's over.
Blake: You guys broke up?

Michelle: And I am going to go pack. I'll 
meet you guys at the airport.

Sebastian: Okay. How is Ross going to feel 
about all this?

Blake: We'll see. I'm just sad that my mom is 
not going to come.
Sebastian: Yeah, so is Roger.

Blake: It's just too bad because it's like 
Dad is reaching out from beyond his grave, and she's just ignoring him.
Holly: That's it, Roger, done, finished.

Roger: Let's understand. Let's get something 
straight, I'm your husband. I have certain rights here.
Holly: Wait, don't!
Roger: You love me, don't you?

Holly: "I care about you, Roger." No, please! 
Don't. No leave me alone, please.

Roger: You love him, you love him. You love 
him.

Holly: Why? Why are you doing this to me? 
You're gone, it's over, it's over now. Don't you hear me?  Alone at last.

Roger: I feel like a bridegroom, a teenaged 
bridegroom. Funny, we still look married.
Holly: Alone at last.

Roger: Holly, it feels like the end of the 
world.
Holly: Why?

Roger: You could love me again at the end of 
the world.

Holly: Let me go. Please. I'm just asking 
you. Please let me go.

Cassie: What you've done for me, it's beyond 
any of your job descriptions.
Jeffrey: Cassie, I would...
Edmund: There you are.
Cassie: Hey, you're late.
Edmund: Well, I couldn't help it.
Cassie: You were saying something?
Jeffrey: No, it's... It's not important.
Cassie: Would you like to join us for dinner?

Jeffrey: No, thank you. I've got a meeting I 
got to get to.
Cassie: Okay.

Jeffrey: So I'll see you later. I can't leave 
her alone for one second. Dinah, what in the blazes are you doing with... 
Assistant Director Reynolds?

Reynolds: Agent O'Neill. Your beautiful 
assistant here was giving me all the dirt on you.
Jeffrey: Oh?

Dinah: Yeah, I was just telling Bob what a 
chameleon you are, and how many personalities you have and you can just go right 
into them in a drop of a hat. (Laughter) it's amazing how your bosses in D.C. 
Don't know this about you.
Jeffrey: Yeah.
Reynolds: Will you excuse us for a moment?
Dinah: Certainly.
Reynolds: Well, you did it.
Jeffrey: I'm afraid I don't understand.

Reynolds: The Salerno case. It was a 
slam-dunk, put you right over the edge for that London post, the job you've 
always wanted.

Jeffrey: Oh. Oh, yeah, that. Well, that's 
great, but...

Reynolds: But nothing. Pack your bags. You 
leave tonight.
Jeffrey: I can't leave Springfield right now.
Reynolds: Why not?

Jeffrey: Because I'm helping a friend. I'm 
helping someone find a friend, I should say, which is why I'm going to turn in 
my resignation, actually.

Reynolds: You can't be serious. Hey, wait a 
minute. Princess Cassie lives here. Now, this isn't because...

Reynolds: Oh. Well, D.C. won't be the same 
without you. If you should change your mind...
Jeffrey: I won't, I won't. But thank you.
Dinah: That seemed very hush-hush.

Jeffrey: Well, I'll save you the snooping. I 
just resigned so that I could devote more time to the D.A.'s office.

Dinah: So now you can settle down in the 
vine-covered cottage with the sheepdog and Cassie. Will you just admit it? You 
want her. There's only one thing standing in your way.
Jeffrey: I think you have work to do.

Dinah: It's wrong timing, Jeffrey. You look 
like the wrong brother.
Edmund: I hate to see you so set.

Cassie: I'm just worried about Tammy. You 
know, she hasn't been herself since the accident. She feels so guilty about 
Sandy.

Edmund: Well, it's survivor's guilt. She'll 
be fine once Sandy is up and around.

Cassie: I want to do something for her--maybe 
take her away. Maybe I can just take her somewhere for a while.

Edmund: Somewhere far, far away from the 
young thug she's taken up with.

Tammy: Sandy, it's okay. It's going to be all 
right. The transplant went well. The doctor said so. Oh, this is JB ... JB, this 
is my cousin, Sandy.

JB: I have been dying to meet you. Tammy's 
told me so much about you that I feel like I already know you. I mean, what can 
you say to the guy who saved your girl, huh?
Tammy: Sandy, you're my hero. You really are.

JB: Man, it's amazing to think that in the 
moment of danger you would put yourself on the line to save another person with 
no thought at all for yourself. Not everyone would do that.
Tammy: It's okay, Sandy. You're okay.

JB: Maybe we should go outside and let him 
get some rest.

Tammy: I think I'd like to spend some time 
alone with him, actually, if that's okay.

JB: Okay, beautiful. I'll see you outside. 
Hey, nice to meet you, Sandy.

Tammy: I know he's kind of rough looking, but 
he's a good guy, Sandy. I like him a lot. Sandy, no.

Reva: I'm going to go back to the house and 
check Sandy's things. I mean, if there were threats, then maybe there's 
something there that can help.

Ross: Reva, you're still recovering. Why 
don't you just let the police handle it?
JB: You miss me?
Nurse: You are such a player.
JB: Play with me then.
Nurse: Okay, all right. Okay, I'll try.

Reva: ??? Sandy's room. If I find anything 
important, I'll let the cops know or I'll call Jeffrey O'Neill.

Ross: You're recovering from major surgery. 
If you do too much, you're going to end up back in the hospital. Why don't you 
just let the police finish this? Reva, I'm sorry. I have to go.
Reva: Is it about the accident?

Ross: It's about another accident, and it's 
just waiting to happen. I'll call you later tonight.
Reva: Okay. Thanks.

Nurse: Hello, where do you think you're 
going?
Reva: I've been released. I was going home.

Nurse: Not until you take your pills. Last 
dose.
Reva: More? Happy?
Nurse: Perfect.
Reva: Okay.
Nurse: Bye now.
Reva: Thanks.

Tammy: Sandy, the nurse is just trying to 
protect you. Your breathing wasn't so good, and this helps you. Who's that?

JB: Oh, nobody. I'm only looking at you, and 
pack.

Sebastian: Chrissy, wait a minute. I never 
had a sister or much of anybody actually, and sometimes... Sometimes I do things 
I don't even understand why.
Blake: Yeah? You said that before.

Sebastian: I know. I know, but if Dad was 
alive he would be furious with me that I even thought about taking something 
away from you. I'm sorry.

Blake: Well, I wish you had been straight 
with me from the beginning, but I'm certainly not one to pass judgment on you.  
Apparently lying runs in this family.

Sebastian: I'm going to have to remember 
that.
Blake: Consider yourself warned.

Sebastian: All right. Well, I'd better make 
some phone calls, make sure the yacht is prepared, and tell the captain to 
expect the three of us.
Holly: Four.

Tony: Okay, hey, I just came by to see if you 
were okay, and by the looks of things you're throwing shoes--whatever--you're 
not. What's going on?

Michelle: I'm fine actually, I'm fine. I'm 
just getting ready to go on a little mystery tour with Sebastian.
Tony: Michelle, I don't like that guy at all.

Michelle: Really? Really? Because I hadn't 
noticed.
Tony: Where did you say you were going again?

Michelle: I didn't, because I don't really 
know.

Tony: Michelle, I don't like this. I don't 
want you to go.

Michelle: Knock it off, Tony. I don't need 
your approval, all right, or anyone else's. I'm going to do what I want to do, 
brain-damaged and all.
Tony: You're not brain-damaged.

Michelle: Yeah, you bet I'm not, all right? 
And I don't need this. All right? I already kicked Danny out, and I will do the 
same to you if you get in my way.
Tony: Okay. So what, it really is over?

Michelle: Look, I gave it my best shot. All 
right? I did it for Robbie because it seemed like the right thing to do. And I 
also thought, you know, something great might come out of it, but it wasn't what 
I thought it was. So it's good-bye, see you later, sayonara.
Tony: What happens now, Michelle? Huh?

Michelle: Why doesn't anyone just say what 
they mean? Because what you're really asking is what does this mean for us?

Reva: Right before the accident, Sandy was 
acting like he was really scared of something, and ... call me back.
Jeffrey: Can I get the check, please?

Dinah: Why don't you tell me where you're 
going?

Jeffrey: I'm going as far away from you as 
possible.

Dinah: You are too uptight. What you need is 
a good massage.
Jeffrey: Dinah.

Dinah: Yeah, and it would keep your mind off 
of Cassie.

Jeffrey: I'm going to pay the check. You stay 
put and be a good little girl.
Dinah: Why? Being bad is a lot more fun.

JB: Alone at last. So how you feeling, buddy? 
Huh? How about that cousin Tammy, huh? She's even cuter than that little chick 
me and you both tried to nail in Switzerland. Oh, God. And she's wild about me, 
too, and so sweet. Innocent. Like a peach. Come here, come here. But all sweet 
things have to turn bad sometimes, with a push from the right person. And you'd 
know all about pushing, wouldn't you? You rest up, buddy, okay? We all need our 
sleep. But unlike you, I won't be going to bed alone tonight. Won't be needing 
this, will you? You rest up. Bye, sleepyhead.

Blake: Oh, Mom, I'm so happy you're coming. 
Daddy would be so happy, too. You won't be sorry.
Holly: We'll see.
Sebastian: What made you change your mind?

Holly: I'm hoping that seeing whatever Roger 
has left behind will help me leave him behind, for good.
Blake: Well, I have to go home and pack.
Holly: Does Ross know you're going?

Blake: I left him a message, which is why I 
know I'm going to get a lecture when I see him, but I'm not going to let him 
talk me out of anything. Not after what he did for Dinah. I mean, my gosh, why 
should I ignore my family when his daughter, the murderer, is running around 
town without a leash?

Dinah: Would it kill you to invite me to 
dinner, let's say, and you could have your very favorite dessert.
Jeffrey: Dinah, I'm warning you.

Dinah: I will behave, all right. I don't know 
if I can vouch, though, for Miss Annie Oakley over there. Hello, young lovers. 
It's a beautiful evening, isn't it?
Cassie: What do you want, Dinah?

Dinah: Well, I'm here to give a little gift 
to celebrate your engagement. My best wishes, of course.
Cassie: No, thanks.

Edmund: Cassie, I think she's just trying to 
smooth things over.
Cassie: Don't defend her, Edmund.

Edmund: I thought I'd keep the peace for one 
evening.
Dinah: I am not here to cause trouble.

Cassie: Yes, you are. Because you thrive off 
of trouble the way others thrive off food. You're a leech, Dinah. You're a 
blood-sucking parasite who doesn't know when to let go.
Dinah: Let go of what?

Cassie: Stop following us around and stop 
trying to insert yourself into every aspect of our lives. And stop walking 
around here like you're some saint when you're the furthest thing from it. And 
stop whatever it is you have cooked up and planned next and get a grip.

Dinah: It was just a bottle of champagne, 
Cassie. Maybe you're the one that needs to get a grip. (Cell phone ringing)
Reva: Hello?

Tammy: Aunt Reva, guess what? Sandy's 
conscious and he's asking for you. Can you get over here right away?
Reva: Of course, Tammy. Of course I can.
Tammy: Okay. Well, hurry.

JB: Things are really looking up for your 
family, huh?
Tammy: Finally.

JB: I think this calls for a celebration, 
don't you?
Tammy: Definitely. Got any ideas?
Sandy: Nurse.

JB: I want to be with you, Tammy. And I think 
you want to be with me.
Tammy: But where can we go?

JB: Didn't you say that Edmund keeps a hotel 
suite that he never uses?

Tammy: Yeah, and I have a spare key. I guess 
I could call him and make sure that he's not over there.

JB: You guess? Are you having second 
thoughts? If you are, no problem. I can drop you off at home.
Tammy: No. I don't want to go home. Let's go.

Reva: No, no, no, no, no. Don't do this now. 
I've got to get to the hospital.

Tony: Hey, Michelle, will you stop for one 
second please and talk to me? You're moving around all over the place. Talk to 
me.

Michelle: Because I'm focusing, Tony, all 
right? On what I want. You know, you and Danny and Sebastian, you guys all are 
working me, trying to get something.

Tony: Hey, I don't want anything from you, 
Michelle. We're business partners. We need to communicate.

Michelle: All right, well, here's a little 
communication for you: Back off, because I'm going on this trip and you can't 
stop me.

Tony: Okay, you know what? Fine. You go and 
you do whatever. I could care less what you do, Michelle. Really.

Michelle: That is so not true. I see the way 
you look at me.
Tony: Really?
Michelle: Yeah.

Tony: Why don't you get over yourself, okay? 
Because I'm here, because, one, we're partners, we work together, and two, 
you've needed me, and don't deny that.

Michelle: Well, I don't need to be saved 
anymore, all right? See, if I have an impulse now or a wish or a freakin' whim, 
I'm going to act on it and I don't care if it hurts somebody or offends them, 
because I'm going to live, Tony, and to hell with the consequences.

Tony: Go live, Michelle. Do whatever it is 
you want to do, all right?
Michelle: Whatever I want?
Tony: Yeah, really.
Michelle: Okay.
Ross: Oh, hi.

Blake: Don't say anything. Just... Let me 
talk first.
Ross: Okay.

Blake: I know you're about to give me a 
dissertation on the evils of my wicked half-brother, all right? And that how I 
don't know what I'm doing, I don't think before I act and this trip is too 
dangerous and I should stay home where I belong, but I've made my decision, 
Ross.

Ross: Yes, I know that and you're leaving. I 
just need to get the kids' schedule straight so I can figure out how to handle 
things while you're gone.
Blake: That's it?

Ross: Yeah, that's it. Now, Clarissa has a 
ballet lesson, but I don't know if it's Thursday or Friday. And the boys have a 
soccer game, but is it home or away?

Blake: Well, I can write that down. Oh, Ross. 
Ross, thank you so much. Oh, honey, I thought for sure you were going to say, 
"Blake, are you out of your skull? What are you doing?"

Ross: Oh, no, no, no. I wouldn't dream of 
doing that. I mean, once you get something in this pretty little head of yours, 
it's impossible to get it out.
Blake: I could just kiss you all day.
Ross: You know, that could be arranged.

Blake: Ross? Do you remember the last time we 
were in a jail cell?

Ross: Oh, yeah. Yeah, I remember. They say 
parting is such sweet sorrow. But it just doesn't have to be, does it?
Blake: I love you.

Ross: And Blake, I love you. And that's why 
you're not going anywhere.
Jeffrey: Reva? You in there?
Reva: Yeah.
Jeffrey: Reva, is that you?
Reva: (Groans)

Jeffrey: Oh, my God, Reva. Are you all right? 
What are you doing down here? What happened?
Reva: You're too late. You're too late.
Jeffrey: I'm too late? I'm too late? What...

Reva: We never should have given him away. 
Because of me. I tried to protect him, and now he might be dead.

Jeffrey: Reva, Reva, Reva. Listen, listen. 
It's okay. Sandy's all right. I just called the hospital. He's fine.
Reva: No.

Jeffrey: And I've got a computer expert 
working on his laptop.

Reva: I'm talking about Jonathan, Richard, 
our son. You have to do something. You have to help him. You have to do 
something.

Jeffrey: Reva? It's Jeffrey, not Richard. 
It's Jeffrey O'Neill here, okay? Come on. Come on, I'm going to help you up. 
We're going to go over there. You need to rest.
Reva: No.
Jeffrey: Come on.
Reva: I can't.
Jeffrey: Take it easy. Here we go.
Reva: I can't.
Jeffrey: Come on.

Reva: If he's gone, I'll never forgive 
myself. Richard, we had this beautiful child together and then we abandoned him, 
and now I've hurt two boys.

Jeffrey: Reva, Reva. Shh. Now, listen to me. 
You sent me a message, all right? You said that Sandy was afraid of somebody. Do 
you know who that might be?
Reva: Richard. Call Marissa.
Jeffrey: Marissa?

Reva: Marissa, Olivia's sister, Jonathan's 
adoptive mother. Maybe if I talk to her, maybe if we work together, we can get 
our baby back. Just make the call, Richard. Please.

Jeffrey: Okay, okay. (In English accent): 
I'm... I'm Richard. It's Richard here, okay, Reva? I'm here and everything's 
going to be all right, okay? You need to lay down.
Reva: Okay.

Jeffrey (in English accent): Okay, let's just 
lay down right here. And everything is going to be all right. Okay?

Reva: Please, you have to do something to 
keep him safe, Richard. Keep him safe.

Jeffrey (in English accent): Okay, of course, 
of course. I'm going to keep everyone safe. But you have to promise me that 
you'll sleep. Now, just close your eyes and go to sleep. That's it. Good girl. 
Yes, hello. This is Jeffrey O'Neill. I'm with a patient of yours that just 
checked out of the hospital, Reva Lewis. Yeah, well, something happened. She may 
have fainted or something. I'm a little concerned. Could you send a doctor over 
here? No, she's laying down now. Yeah. Okay, good. Good. Thank you.
Reva: Jeffrey?
Jeffrey: Yeah.
Reva: What are you doing here?

Jeffrey: Well, hello. Something happened. You 
may have fainted or something and I called the hospital. Everything's going to 
be okay. A doctor is on his way, okay? I'm going to try to find your sister, 
Cassie. I think she's over at Towers. She's not answering her phone. All right? 
You just stay there, okay?
Reva: Richard?
Jeffrey: Yes.
Reva: I'm feeling much better now. Thank you.

Sandy: (Hoarsely): Nurse. Nurse. You have to 
warn Reva.

Nurse: Your mother is fine. She's been sent 
home.
Sandy: No. I have to warn her before he...
Nurse: This will help you relax.
Sandy: It's Tammy. Tammy. No, no.
Nurse: It's all right.
Sandy: Cousin Tammy.

Nurse: It's all right. You're fine. Relax. 
Let the sedative do its work.
Sandy: Tammy.
JB: Tammy.
Tammy: How many girls have you been with?

JB: It doesn't matter. I've never wanted to 
be with anyone the way I want to be with you.

Tammy: I just hope I don't disappoint you. 
It's not like I've ever...
JB: All you have to do is relax and enjoy.
Tammy: Right.
JB: You're not scared, are you?

Tammy: No. Well, maybe a little. I mean, 
it's... It's my first time.

JB: Hey, don't be so worried. I'm going to 
make this a night you'll never forget.
Blake: Let me out of here!

Ross: Blake, I am doing this for your own 
good.

Blake: Oh, like hell you are. You're just 
afraid you're going to get embarrassed, that the whole town is going to laugh at 
you because the mayor's wife got involved in some crazy scheme again.

Ross: Oh, come on, Blake. Do you think after 
all these years together, I'm worried about saving face? What I want to do is 
save you, honey. I love you and I don't want to lose you.

Blake: Lose me? What do you think is going to 
happen?

Ross: I don't know, but I cannot shake this 
feeling of dread, this feeling that Sebastian is up to no good.
Holly: Where is everybody?

Sebastian: They'll be here. But I'm glad 
you're first. It gives us an opportunity to get to know each other a little 
better.
Holly: Are we flying into Miami?

Sebastian: And from there, we board a private 
yacht. Everything arranged according to father's specifications.

Holly: Was Roger confident everyone would 
come?

Sebastian: Well, what's important is that the 
circle is now complete, and everything is coming together as intended.

Holly: And what exactly is coming together? 
Where exactly are we going?
Sebastian: Into the past.

Jeffrey: Cassie, hi. I'm so glad that you're 
still here. It's about Reva.
Cassie: What about her?

Jeffrey: Well, she's just not feeling too 
well. She's not acting herself. I called the hospital and they're sending a 
doctor.
Edmund: Where is she?

Jeffrey: She's at home. She's going to be 
okay, don't worry. I mean, I did find her semi-conscious. I helped her onto the 
couch and I just don't think that she should be alone, that's all.

Cassie: Oh, absolutely. Okay, I'm going to 
go. Excuse me.
Jeffrey: Cassie?
Cassie: Yeah?

Jeffrey: When she was delirious, she thought 
that I was Richard. I didn't want to upset her and I wanted her to remain calm, 
so I let her believe that. I hope I didn't take advantage of the situation or 
anything.

Cassie: No, no, no. Don't apologize. You did 
what you had to do. Thank you. Thank you.
Jeffrey: Okay.

Dinah: Well, well. There goes your princess. 
You better get on your white horse and start galloping after her.

Jeffrey: I thought I told you to stay away 
from Edmund and Cassie.

Dinah: Well, there he is. Prince Richard the 
magnificent, ruler of all San Cristobel. How did it feel to have that much power 
back again, huh? To impersonate the lucky man who got to go home with Cassie 
every night.
Jeffrey: You talk too much.
Tony: You know, if I was a good guy...
Michelle: Yeah?

Tony: If I was a good guy, I would make you 
walk out that door, because I know you're doing this because you're mad at 
Danny. And I would tell you... Michelle, I would tell you to run. But I never 
said I was a good guy.
Reva: No. No. Sandy.
JB: You are so beautiful.
Tammy: Not really.

JB: Yes, you are. The face of an angel. So 
pure and trusting.
Tammy: What?

JB: I love the look of innocence on your
